word: Let us remember that doubts are dangerous. If entertained, they lead to unbelief. . . . All our people need now to seek for the impartation of the Holy Spirit. Enter into no contention, but put away dissension and strife, and seek to answer the prayer recorded in the seventeenth chapter of John. I beg of you to pray, pray, with heart and soul and voice.--Letter 58, Jan. 16, 1906, to Brethren Washburn, Prescott, Daniells, Colcord.
